course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Biodiversity
course.description: This course introduces students to the diversity of life and habitats; the evolution and extinction of species; the values of biodiversity; challenges to the biodiversity and conservation approaches; the interrelationships between humans/biodiversity and the environment. Examples (local and global) and applications will be included to highlight the key concepts.

reviews.author: Katkatkathy
reviews.comment_content: 主要都係taxonomy, evolution, concept唔太難理解, 但係好多野背, 例如fungi嗰d,
reviews.comment_teaching: Binbin講野好細聲, 坐後少少都聽唔到, 不過佢份ppt整得唔錯, 完全係書嘅keynotes, Qinglu一般般, 前後兩者之間, Ice Ko堂走咗會gg
reviews.comment_grading: 有温書都唔會爛grade，份midterm會比想像中容易
reviews.comment_workload: 背野背到痴線, 最好堂堂都温一温, 唔係一到考試會癲

reviews.author: flyflyyip
reviews.comment_content: Zeng, Qinglu 的內容算是簡單的, 但之後Liu Hongbin的就內容超多, 是講分類的, 有超多極難的單字. Ice Ko的都還可以
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice ko的堂不能走,
她上傳在canvas的ppt並不是完整的version, 所以走堂的話就會錯失好多東西.
而且她很喜歡叫人答問題, 不怕答的就坐哪裡也沒所謂, 怕的話就建議不要坐太前及坐太邊.
reviews.comment_grading:
有一次midterm,一次final
midterm的很容易, 但final因為ice ko佔超級多, 不論mc還是long question她也喜歡出要你思考的問題. 所以考完之後身邊的人都唉...
原本以為會低分, 因為無時間做完所有題目, 但出來的成績都不錯, 有a-, 所以grading還可以吧
reviews.comment_workload:
唯一的Workload就是背生字...
特別是分類的部份, 雖則不會要你串出來, 但要大約知道意思

reviews.author: ericltt
reviews.comment_content:
Not too difficult to understand, some may even find it boring

Ice KO:
The value of biodiversity
Habitat diversity and biomes
Tropical rainforests
Coral reefs
Loss of biodiversity and Ecological conservation  

Cynthia YAU:
Biodiversity of Hong Kong
Origins of Life on Earth: a brief history
Systematics and phylogeny
Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi
Invertebrate diversity
Vertebrate diversity (did not finish the bird and mammal parts)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cynthia YAU:
sometimes she will share some interesting things related to the topics, like how her friend found a unknown speices of jellyfish and asked her to indentify. Overall experience is ok la.

Ice KO:
Already heard a lot about her teaching, so no need to repeat. But one thing, about the " exam trial run" she held since she thought students "may not be too familiar with this online exam experience", and she made it mandatory. The exam trial run is indeed a practise of online exam, but not for the students, but for her. You will see a lot of, "there are some technical issues", "there must be some delay", "professor, I can't see the quiz".
reviews.comment_grading:
Even this course is 2000+, it is easier than you may expect, plus the exams are open book. And because of that the means were so high.
Mid term: 33.3/45
Final: 49.3/59 (80% is the mean)

Grade: above mean can get B :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Only need to keep up with the lectures and study the ppt from time to time.

1 mid term, 1 final

reviews.author: lukluk
reviews.comment_content:
Ice Ko covered
- The value of biodiversity
- Habitat diversity and biomes
- Tropical rainforests
- Coral Reefs
- Human effects: Loss of biodiversity
- Biological conservation and restoration

Cynthia Yau covered:
- Biodiversity of Hong Kong
- Biodiversity through time: a brief history
- Systematics and classification
- Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi
- Invertebrate diversity
- Deuterostomes
- Vertebrate diversity
- Speciation and extinction
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both professors are quite passionate in teaching. They explain concepts in details with examples and interesting videos. I attended most of the lectures and jotted notes for the videos because some questions asked were not based on the PowerPoints.

Quite rush for some lessons because some classes were cancelled
reviews.comment_grading:
Above mean for the mid term exam: 44 out of 55 (mean: 36.2, SD: 7.5)
but can't access the grade of final exam (online exam)
Eventually got an A
reviews.comment_workload:
Only mid term and final exam so you only have to do revision.
The final exam covered quite a large portion of the content so one day is definitely not enough
it took me really hard and long time to memorise them

reviews.author: msdaydream
reviews.comment_content:
First part of the course by Dr Ko is on conservation and corals
Second part of the course by Dr. Yau is on taxonomy
reviews.comment_teaching:
You have to supplement Dr. Ko's teaching with the recommended textbook. She tries to cover the topic extensively which took up a lot of time and ended up skipping some slides. The textbook chapters are actually pretty similar to what she said in class. DO NOT IGNORE IN-CLASS DISCUSSIONS!!! I took detailed notes of the videos she showed in class which only turned out to be a 3 mark unimportant question in the midterm. However, our first discussion topic on why there is a wide range of uncertainties in biodiversity turned out to be a LQ.
For Dr. Yau, she is really friendly when I approached her for questions and her British accent adds clarity to the lectures she gave. You dont have to supplement her teaching with the textbook ks the textbook overload you with details that wont come up in the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm:41.5/55
Mean: 36.4/54, SD:7.2
Final:??/65
Overall grade:A-
fair grading since I did poorly in midterm but I think I did well in my final exams
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the heavy workload is from Dr. Ko's lectures since you have to remember all the details that she mentioned in class, including ones from the video. You also have to copy a lot of notes in her classes and are subject to her classroom rules.
I skipped most of Dr. Yau's lectures but reviewed her lecture videos which I would say are sufficient for exams.

reviews.author: YSA
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include:

Origin of Life and Chemical Evolution
Evolution of Life: Darwin’s Theory
Evidence for Evolution
Microevolution (Genes within Populations)
Characteristics and Classification of Life
Bacteria and Viruses
Protists
Green Plants
Fungi
Animals
Five Agents of Evolution Change
Species Concept; Macroevolution (Speciation)
Species Extinction
The Value of Biodiversity
Habitat Diversity and Biomes
Tropical Rainforests
Coral Reefs
Human Effects: Loss of Biodiversity
Ecological Conservation and Restoration

The content is quite easy and straightforward, mostly requires memorization of simple facts. The topics in the middle about different organism kingdoms (bacteria, protists, fungi, plants, animals) are very boring and too many things to memorize. Other topics are interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Zeng is quite nice, explains topics very clearly and shows some fun videos from time to time. Prof. Ko also explains topics well. Prof. Liu teaches the topics about the organism groups which is unbelievably boring and is impossible to stay awake for the entire lecture.

All the professors upload very detailed and clear lecture notes which have every information needed for the exams, so skipping any/all lectures is fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: ~40-50% (not sure)
Final: ~50-60% (not sure)

Both exams have MCQs and few short questions. Very straightforward, if you memorize everything from the lecture notes it's not hard to get 100%.

Midterm mean was 63, I got 87 (>1 SD above mean). Don't know the final exam scores, but probably ~1 SD above mean. Overall grade A.
reviews.comment_workload: Nothing other than the midterm and final. Both the exams do not require too much preparation, just memorization of about ~200-250 slides.

reviews.author: Shin, Woo-hong
reviews.title: Light and easy course
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are easy and very fun in terms of evolutionary aspects.

TANG's parts
Biodiversity of Time
Origins of Life
Introduction to microorganisms
Biodiversity of Prokaryotes
Diversity of Viruses

KO's parts
Systematics & Classification
Protists
Fungi
Microbial Systems-On and Around Us
Vertebrates
Invertebrates
Seedless and Seed Plants
The Value of Biodiversity
Habitat Diversity and Biomes
Tropical Rainforests
Coral Reefs
Loss of Biodiversity & Ecological Conservation

Dr. Ice KO mostly teaches the contents, so you should get familiar with her teaching. I had to take this for my major requirement, and it was a very interesting and good course for learning the evolutionary pathway of the organism.
reviews.comment_teaching: the teaching was straightforward. Both professors helped me to deal with the uncertain parts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unfortunately, I studied hard on this course, but I got B+ for the course
There are two exams and the formats are MCQs.
Midterm Exam (35%)
The exam was out of 59
The mean is 40.36
The SD is 7.23
I was around 0.8 s.d.

Final Exam (65%)
Not released
reviews.comment_workload:
There are two exams and the formats are MCQs.
Midterm Exam (35%)
Final Exam (65%)

reviews.author: Galaxy
reviews.comment_content:
-Systematics & Classification
-The History and Origins of Life on Earth
-Introduction to Microorganisms
-Diversity of Microbial Life: Archaea and Bacteria
-Diversity of Microbial Life: Viruses
-Diversity and Ecological Importance of Fungi
-Microbiomes: Microbial Systems on and around Us
-Protists
-Invertebrates (I)
-Invertebrates (II)
-Vertebrates (I)
-Vertebrates (II)
-Seedless & Seed Plants (I)
-Seedless & Seed Plants (II)
-The Value of Biodiversity (I)
-The Value of Biodiversity (II)
-Habitat Diversity & Biomes (I)
-Habitat Diversity & Biomes (II)
-Tropical Rainforests
-Coral Reefs (I)
-Coral Reefs (II)
-Loss of Biodiversity and Ecological Conservation
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is good and the instructors are willing to explain the concepts more clearly if you have any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
You can get a good grade if you are willing to put effort in memorizing things and study hard.

The examination is not that hard and is fair to me.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only midterm and final exam. No homework and projects. Don't have heavy workload. The instructors will mention additional information in class and is not included in the PowerPoint that is provided to students. So, you need to pay attention in class and mark down the information mentioned.

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: A memory test
reviews.comment_content: The content is about biodiversity, which can be interesting for some people. For me, I found the part talking how life came from fascinating, but not so interesting for the classification and stuff afterwards. Nevertheless, this course teaches you different things about different living things. So if you are interested in learning more, this course is quite good. However, the contents are mostly strict forward and what you have to do is to recite everything. So this could be a problem for some people.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both instructors are good at teaching. They explain thing’s clearly and they have passion in teaching. Let that sink in.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think if you recite everything thoroughly you would get a good grade.

Midterm: 35% (54/59)
Exam: 65% (don’t know)
My grade: A+

To me, they are equally “difficult “. But as long as you recite everything, you will be fine. So I would suggest you revise everything earlier.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework or project. The only thing you have to do is to recite everything. Although you don’t need to attend the lectures (no attendance), it is recommended to go because the teaching is good and the instructors often add something that are not included in the PowerPoint. So you will miss those additional content if you miss the lectures.

reviews.comment_workload:
for non LIFS major student
this course is just pure memorization course

My opinion:
midterm is much more difficult
time for final is tight


no need to attend class cuz the extra powerpoint slides are useless most of the time. Ask some try-hard friends for the extra slides if you reli want to study them before exam.

Scoring high in final can totally compensate your messed up midterm scores

Focus on studying the bold words and understanding the graphs and figures. So u could finish studying the final syllabus in 3 days (my case). Try-hard for 2 or 3 days then u can get good grade.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessica:
Nothing to comment and fair teaching. Sometimes she played pop music before classes to wake us up (She always do that in her classes)

Ice Ko:
Actually she taught very well and she explained concepts very clearly, although she always promotes lifs activities during classes which were quite annoying. I think she is passionate in teaching and talking to students.

Overall the atmosphere was quite interactive cause some classmates responded to the lecturers actively.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 35%
45/59; Mean: 40.36; SD: 7.23
Final: 65%
Mark not released
Final grade: B+
Ice Ko' courses are known to be harsh in grading. I studied LIFS1030 and I know how harsh it was. Around mean will get u B- or even C+. I think I did well in final so I get B+ surprisingly. Remember to do well in final.
reviews.comment_workload: Only midterm and final. But lots of stuff to be remembered in final exam. I spent 5 days to study so remember to start your study early.

reviews.author: Derrick1120
reviews.comment_content:
Ice KO:
The value of biodiversity
Guest Lecture by Yau: Biodiversity of Hong Kong
Habitat diversity and biomes
Tropical rainforests
Coral reefs
Loss of biodiversity and Ecological conservation  

Jessica Tang:
Origin of Life
Diversity of Prokaryotes
Diversity of Viruses
Diversity of Microbes in human
Biodiversity and human health
Diversity of Fungi

LI Laam's:
Protists
Invertebrates
Vertebrates
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko explanation is quite clear. But she has a lot of rules and she likes to ask questions.

Jessica Tang is nice. But she does not know what we have learnt and what we have not. So sometimes she spent a lot of time explaining stuff that we already know. And her pace was inconsistent because she always ran out of time.

Amy Li is nice and her explanation is also clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 40% 40MC 35 mins
Mean 27/40 SD:5
Final: 60% 70MC 60mins
The score of the final exam is not released.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignments. Must study hard if you want to get a good score in exams. Especially for the final exam, Amy Li's part needs a lot of memorization. Better start to revise early.

reviews.author: Frankie:)
reviews.title: Ice Ko kills me again
reviews.comment_content:
This course is co-taught by 3 different instructors
Ice KO's Part:(Midterm Coverage)
The value of biodiversity
Guest Lecture by Yau: Biodiversity of Hong Kong
Habitat diversity and biomes
Tropical rainforests
Coral reefs
Loss of biodiversity and Ecological conservation  

Jessica Tang's Part:(Final Exam Coverage)
Origin of Life
Diversity of Prokaryotes
Diversity of Viruses
Diversity of Microbes in human
Biodiversity and human health
Diversity of Fungi

LI Laam's Part:(Final Exam Coverage)
Protists
Invertebrates
Vertebrates

Contentwise, Ice Ko's parts are all common sense and easy to handle and remember. However, her midterm exam questions are quit weird and some of them were from her extra information taught and mentioned from her lectures. Make sure u make notes and jot down anything she mentioned in the class.

As for the final exam part, I must admit that there were lots of content to be covered and memorized. However, as long as u did sufficient revision, your hard work will definitely be paid off.
However, for Ice Ko's part, your diligence may not help that much since her lecture contents were easy to understand but midterm MCQ questions were tricky and u would be indecisive in choosing which answers will be the most suitable.

And for this semester, Tang and Li were assigned to teach these courses for the FIRST time since Dr.Yau was no longer in charge of the latter half of the courses.

Due to the black rainstorm signal and typhoon No.8, 2 lectures were canceled. The midterm exam was postponed twice!
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mediocre
Ice Ko lectures were quite restrictive. She didn't allow students to eat lunch during her lecture times. She tends to walk around and randomly ask students questions

As for Tang and Amy, I think Amy's lectures were better. Pay attention to the extra details that Amy mentioned during the lectures. they will appears in the Final Exam
reviews.comment_grading:
Normal grading.
I would say if u screw up in midterm, it is nearly impossible to get a good grade unless u make up for your lost scores a lot in the final exam.

For Ice Ko's part, midterm questions are more straightforward than the questions that appeared in OCES1030/LIFS1030. Some MCQ will ask u about:
-which of the following are reef-building corals?
-which is not indirect economic value derived from biodiversity?
-Plantation belongs to which types of ecosystem restoration?
-Which of the following is not bioremediation?
-which species are not endemic to HK?

As for the Final exam:
-What is the difference that differentiates prokaryotes from eukaryotes?
-Should fungi be grown in moist and dry environments?
-why colony disappears after Viral Infection?
-which families are the most related to plant?

Midterm (40%). 40MCQs 35 mins
Final (60%). 70MCQs 60mins

Scores:

Midterm: 32/40 Mean 27/40 SD:5 +1.0SD
Final: -/70. Mean: -/40 SD: Null

Letter Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Ice Ko's Part: Low to medium
Final exam: High, lots of things to be memorized, especially for Amy's part.

reviews.author: chms
reviews.title: NOT for students who are NOT good at memorization!! (Not very recommended)
reviews.comment_content:
I'm not a student from OCES, not familiar with things like ecology or biodiversity but overall, I found the content quite interesting. It feels like watching a documentary in depth (of course documentaries are much more interesting).

Stuff before midterm is very easy, not so much things to memorize. Most are just common sense stuff (except the chapter talking about coral and guest lecture). YES!! Guest lecture you have to study and memorize! Though not many questions about it in midterm.

Stuff after midterm is like HELL, I'm talking about the content of Amy. Her lectures are relaxing and interesting but the intensity is tooooo high!! Many many names to memorize, including examples!! And many things about those protists and invertebrates are just nonlogical!! What you need to do is just rote learning. (But I should admit that I only spent a few days on Amy's lecture so I cannot enjoy it. Actually biodiversity is fascinating!)

NOTE: I don't think reviewing textbooks they provided is helpful, lecture ppts are more than enough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I give likes to them all because there's nothing wrong with them...... just that the lecture content after midterm is way too depressive.

Ice KO has good logic in her lectures but she kind of... treated us like high school fellows. She likes to ask questions and would not continue with the lecture unless she found someone to answer it. She likes to talk about extra stuff in her lecture so attending lectures is a must, though I don't think she put a lot of extra stuff in midterm.

Jessica's PPT content is the most interesting among all but her teaching is just fair, mostly are just following the ppt.

Amy is good at teaching, she explained everything in her lectures and she always smile. Liked!
reviews.comment_grading:
Before midterm: easy.
After midterm: Hadean.

As I said, stuff after midterm is very intensive and hell hard, required lots of lots of memorization!!!

Things before midterm are just common sense. 30 mins 40 MC questions, I finished in 23 mins and got 36/40, mean 27, SD 5. I guess several people also got this result.

Final is 60 mins 70 MC questions. I don't know why but Jessica's questions are harder and require more logic than her lecture content. Amy's part needs MEMORIZATION!! I didn't have time to memorize everything so I has a lot of questions didn't know how to do.

Final mark is not released. I guess I got fifty something to sixty something.

Eventually A+. Luckily.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, no homework or stuff but you need to do a lot of revision.

reviews.author: Daniel's
reviews.comment_content:
Content before midterm are relatively easier

Massive content after midterm
A lot of taxonomy related words that need reciting, especially those related to protist /invertebrate.

I've attached the course outline, too lazy to type them all in.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko
Like to trash talk in class, and lecturing students about their behavior (e.g. using too much foul language, always looking at their phones, being late……) though the teaching was somehow good, at least it’s less boring than the other 2. I must also admit the part that she taught was the easiest, and the content similar to the course environmental science

Dr. Tang
Little boring, usually read from ppt from page to page will little cohesion between pages. Sometimes I get a little lost while listening to her lecture as there’s no connection between pages. She also speaks slowly, so watching zoom in x2 speed can really save our time.

Dr. Li
Her part is mainly reciting "taxonomy" related information, so the lecture may sound a little boring. She still adds some interesting information to the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unsure, the score for final is not released

Mid-term:
Full marks 40 (mean:27, SD:5)
around 35 min for 40 questions
All MC w/. 4 option
(p.s. Ice Ko like to ask students to arrive 15 minutes later while she start the exam around 20 minutes after the original class time)

Final:
70 Questions
around an hour
All MC w/. 5 options
reviews.comment_workload: Only mid term and final

reviews.author: kakaka
reviews.comment_content:
The content is quite interesting and easy to understand.
Ice Ko's part:
- the value of biodiversity
- habitat diversity and biomes
- tropical rainforest
- coral reefs
- loss of biodiversity and ecological conservation
Cynthia Yau's part:
- Biodiversity of HK
- Orgins of life on earth
- systematics and phylogeny
- evolutionary diversity of plants 1
- evolutionary diversity of plants 2 and fungi
- invertebrate diversity 1 (basal animal phyla)
- invertebrate diversity 2 (wormy things)
- invertebrate diversity 3 (the mighty molluscs)
- invertebrate diversity 4 (ecdysozoa)
- invertebrate diversity 5 (deuterostomes)
- vertebrate diversity 1 (fishes)
- vertebrate diversity 2 (terrestrial tetrapods)
- vertebrate diversity 3 (archosaurs)

She didn't cover the mammals part as the class was behind schedule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both of their teachings is quite good. For Ice Ko, you might need to attend the lectures since she will pause the recording when she's showing videos. Also, her PowerPoint will contain additional information compared to the ones she uploaded on Canvas. You'll need to copy it as it might be tested as well.
For Cynthia, her parts are quite easy to understand. The lecture slides basically summarize everything she will talk about during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is reasonable.
Midterm: 40%
Final: 60%

Midterm: 33/45
MT mean: 33.31/45

Final: 50/59
Final mean: 49.33/59

Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Only 1 midterm and 1 final. So the workload isn't really too much.

reviews.author: KIKC
reviews.title: Ice Ko :(
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are not difficult to understand and they are quite interesting.

Before midterm is taught by ice ko.
The value of biodiversity
Habitat diversity and biomes
Tropical rainforests
Coral reefs
Loss of biodiversity and Ecological conservation  

After midterm is taught by Cynthia.
Biodiversity of Hong Kong
Biodiversity through time: a brief history
Systematics and classification
Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi
Invertebrate diversity
Deuterostomes
Vertebrate diversity
Speciation and extinction

Due to the time limit, Cynthia did not cover all the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko: She is good at explaining the content of the powerpoint. However, she is troublesome. She hates someone who is late for the class. Also, she did not allow student to use mobile phone, computer or iPad during the class. You need to attend all of her lectures since her powerpoint are not complete. You need to write all she said during the class. Also, she played lots of video and the content of those video will appear in the midterm. ALL OF HER LECTURES WILL NOT BE RECORDED! You should be careful about it.

Cynthia: She is good at explaining different content. Also, she knows many extra things about the biodiversity of HK. You can learn many things from her if you enjoy learning biodiversity. Unlike ice ko, Cynthia did not have rule during the class. Also, her lectures will be recorded so don't worry if you miss her lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% midterm
65% final

The grade is not good. You can only get your mark from midterm and you cannot check the paper. The transparency is zero. Ice Ko think she will not mark the midterm wrong. :(
Midterm: around mean
Final: unknown
Final grade: C  :(
I think the mean should be around C/C+.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one midterm and one final. The workload is quite light. The content are quite easy.

reviews.author: Persayus
reviews.comment_content:
content in this course is quite interesting.

Ice Ko
- The value of biodiversity
- Habitat diversity and biomes
- Tropical rainforests
- Coral Reefs
- Human effects: Loss of biodiversity
- Biological conservation and restoration

Cynthia Yau
- Biodiversity of Hong Kong
- Biodiversity through time: a brief history
- Systematics and classification
- Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi
- Invertebrate diversity
- Deuterostomes
- Vertebrate diversity
- Speciation and extinction
reviews.comment_teaching:
Some concepts and details are explained with videos, which are quite interesting. some of the contents in the videos were asked in the exam and midterm,
so do pay attention and jot notes.
the teaching in this semester is a bit rush as some classes were cancelled.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm: 37/55
(mean: 36.2, SD: 7.5)

exam (online exam)
details not shown

Got B
reviews.comment_workload:
there are no essays and no presentations, only one midterm and final exam.
the midterm and final will cover the lecture ppt and those videos played during the lessons. just revise the PowerPoints and your notes would be enough.
there are some specific terms and scientific names for organisms that you need to memorize. so don't expect you can do revision one night before the midterm n final.

reviews.author: yyycccc
reviews.comment_content:
Dr. Ko covered:
-The value of biodiversity
-Habitat diversity and biomes
-Tropical rainforests
-Coral reefs
-Ecological conservation and restoration
Dr. Yau covered:
-Systematics and classification
-Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi
-Invertebrate diversity
-Deuterostomes
-Vertebrate diversity
-Speciation and extinction
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is recommended to attend Dr.Ko's lectures since some contents in the slides are missing and you have to jot them down during lectures, video were played during the lectures and some mt questions maybe based on the videos.
More contents are covered by Dr.Yau, she speaks with good accent but the lectures were boring sometimes, not many students attended her lectures comparing to Dr.Ko's.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading.
reviews.comment_workload: only midterm and final exam. Lots of contents to be revised for final exam.

reviews.author: hoiman
reviews.comment_content: Dr Cynthia's part is more demanding comparing with Dr ice ko. Exam questions are straight forward.
reviews.comment_teaching: You must attend all lecture, although no attendance will be ticked. No lecture video. This semester released Dr cynthia part's lecture video after November. I guess there will be no lecture video in a normal situation.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a heavy workload. Only mid term and final exam. But you really need to study hard for the mid term and final exam. The format of the exam will be  MC questions and short questions.

reviews.author: Kw/C
reviews.comment_content:
very interesting to someone like this kind of knowledge like me, a bit too much content though
Ice taught before mid-term, Cynthia taught after mid-term

1) Sept 3 (Tue) Course introduction & The value of biodiversity (I)
2) Sept 5 (Thu) The value of biodiversity (II)
3) Sept 10 (Tue) Habitat diversity and biomes
4) Sept 12 (Thu) Biodiversity of Hong Kong
5) Sept 17 (Tue) Tropical rainforests (I)
6) Sept 19 (Thu) Tropical rainforests (II)
7) Sept 24 (Thu) Coral reefs (I)
8) Sept 26 (Tue) Coral reefs (II)
9) Oct 3 (Thu) Mid-term Examination
10) Oct 8 (Tue) Human effects: Loss of biodiversity
11) Oct 10 (Thu) Ecological conservation and restoration
12) Oct 15 (Tue) Biodiversity through time: a brief history
13) Oct 17 (Thu) Systematics and classification
14) Oct 22 (Tue) Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi I
15) Oct 24 (Thu) Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi II
16) Oct 29 (Tue) Invertebrate diversity I: Basal animal phyla - sponges;cnidarians; ctenophores
17) Oct 31 (Thu) Invertebrate diversity II: “Wormy things” - platyhelminthes;annelids
18) Nov 5 (Tue) Invertebrate diversity III: Molluscan success
19) Nov 7 (Thu)Invertebrate diversity IV: Ecdysozoa – roundworms;crustaceans; arthropod success
20) Nov 12 (Tue) Deuterostomes – echinoderms and early chordates
21) Nov 14 (Thu) Vertebrate diversity I: Fishes – aquatic vertebrates success
22) Nov 19 (Tue)Vertebrate diversity II: Terrestrial tetrapods – amphibians;evolution of amniotes; reptiles
23) Nov 21 (Thu) Vertebrate diversity III: Archosaurs; dinosaurs; birds
24) Nov 26 (Tue) Vertebrate diversity IV: The mammals
25) Nov 28 (Thu) Speciation and extinction
reviews.comment_teaching: Both are very nice. Ice likes stu to be active and answer questions. Her ppt is different from the ppt in canvas so make sure to attend classes. She will go through those parts pretty quick because she doesn't like you to write down everything that is missing in your ppt. Videos play in class also include in test so play attention, better take note/find video later yourself. Cynthia does not need stu to interact as much as Ice likes to. Her voice is a bit low so sit in the front.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term
Mean: 36.4 High: 51.5 Low: 16.5

final don't know yet. Grading is so so so slow.
reviews.comment_workload: very light. only mid-term and final exam. But there are lots of lots of things need to be memorized so you need to spend some time to study.

reviews.author: hi_hello
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm content:
The value of biodiversity (I)
The value of biodiversity (II)
Habitat diversity and biomes
Biodiversity of Hong Kong
Tropical rainforests (I)
Tropical rainforests (II)
Coral reefs (I)
Coral reefs (II)

Concept based

Final content:
Human effects: Loss of biodiversity
Ecological conservation and restoration
Biodiversity through time: a brief history
Systematics and classification
Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi I
Evolutionary diversity of plants and fungi II
Invertebrate diversity I: Basal animal phyla – sponges; cnidarians; ctenophores
Invertebrate diversity II: “Wormy things” –platyhelminthes; annelids
Invertebrate diversity III: Molluscan success
Invertebrate diversity IV: Ecdysozoa – roundworms; Yau crustaceans; arthropod success
Deuterostomes – echinoderms and early chordates
Vertebrate diversity I: Fishes – aquatic vertebrates success
Vertebrate diversity II: Terrestrial tetrapods – amphibians; Yau evolution of amniotes; reptiles
Vertebrate diversity III: Archosaurs; dinosaurs; birds
Vertebrate diversity IV: The mammals
Speciation and extinction

a lot, I mean I a lot of information
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko: She teaches well. Her concepts are clear.
Cynthia Yau: Teaching is poor. Digress a lot from the topic. Makes jokes that no one laughs.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% mid term
65% final
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid term: understanding concepts
Final: a lot of memorization but became online exam

reviews.author: MetalFusion
reviews.title: Not a full review yet
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm:
15 MCQs
5 SQ
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko:
Go to her lectures if you want good grades. Powerpoints on canvas are always missing some slides or content. Attending her lectures is a must.
Rules to follow:
1. Don't take pictures of slides
2. Don't talk and sit down when she is talking
3. Be punctual or don't attend at all
4. Answer her questions (please just do this, it was very torturing to wait 10 minutes for someone to answer)
Cynthia Yau:
Very thorough with her explanation, lots of examples so you can understand what she is talking about.

reviews.comment_content:
content before midterm is a bit difficult, which requires to memorise lots of things about the classification of organisms.
content after the midterm is relatively easy because most of the content was taught in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Karen is a funny professor, her lessons were never boring.
Ice Ko is a strict professor but she can deliver the message clearly and understandable.
Professor Zeng is a relatively new professor in ust. He talks softly and sometimes hard to hear. He usually plays videos during lessons to make the lessons less boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is good.
although final weight heavier than midterm but the content for final is much easier than midterm
reviews.comment_workload: light, just midterm and final

reviews.author: CY
reviews.comment_content:
1.Introduction
2.Defining biological diversity
3.Biodiversity of Hong Kong
4.Biodiversity through time: a brief history
5.Introductory taxonomy
6.Introductory animal diversity: Invertebrates
7.Introductory animal diversity: Chordates
8. Origin of life; Chemical evolution
9. Evolution of life: Darwin’s Theory
10. Evidence for evolution
11. Microevolution (genes within populations)
12. Five agents of evolution change
13. Species concept; Macroevolution (speciation)
14. Species extinction
15. The future of evolution
16. The value of biodiversity
17. Habitat diversity and biomes
18. Tropical rainforests
19. Coral reefs
20. Human effects: Loss of biodiversity
21. Ecological conservation and restoration

NB: Part 1-7 taught by Karen Chan; Part 8-15 taught by Zeng Qinglu; Part 16-20 Taught by Ice Ko
reviews.comment_teaching: I did not attend many of the lectures. So I do not think it is appropriate to comment on their lecture styles.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment Scheme

Midterm Examination (35%)
NB: Mid term exam covers from part 1-8 only
Final Examination (65%)
NB: Final exam is non-cumulative

Statistics

Mid term exam
Mean: 47/80
SD: 14/80
Me: 40.5/80

Final Exam
Mean: 65.8/100
SD: 13.2/100
Me: 74.5/100

My grade: B-
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is about the mid term examination and the final examination. But note that there is a myriads of contents for you to memorise so a considerable time has to spent on this course.

reviews.author: hoiyan
reviews.title: Very interesting and easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Liu Hong Bin teaches the classification of organisms which includes quite a lot of new words that required memorisation.

Zeng Qing Lu teaches the evolution part which includes the darwin's theory, natural selection, etc. Quite easy if you have taken genetics in secondary school biology lessons.

Ice Ko teaches different kinds of biomes, particularly focuses in tropical rainforests and coral reefs. And some more contents about conservation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liu Hong Bin: his voice is quite low and what he said can all be found in the notes, so i think it is okay to skip some lessons, if you are attending, you better find a closer seat.

Zeng Qing Lu: quite a lot of videos, his teaching is okay, but also, his notes include everything.

Ice Ko: she is the most interactive lecturer, often asking questions in lessons, most importantly, the handout does not include everything on her ppt, so it is highly recommended to attend all her lessons. Her teaching is the best, not reading words from ppt but explaining things in laymen terms so i am sure you can get at least 80% of the content without memorising.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the course is not so difficult, it is very easy to get high scores in exams but difficult to get a good grade i guess.

Got 90% in midterm, and i guess a similar score in final. Got an A at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload, only midterm and final exam. No projects or attendance taking.

The handouts are quite short, and final is not accumulative.

Overall saying, it is an relatively relaxing course among all LIFS courses.

reviews.author: Andy HK
reviews.title: rote memorization
reviews.comment_content:
characteristics of life, classification of life, bacteria and viruses, protists, green plants, fungi, animal, evoution, five agents of evolutionary change, speciation, species extinction, the future of evolution, the value of biodiversity, habitat diversity and biome, tropical rainforest, coral reef, ecological conservation and restoration, loss of biodiversity.
I think speciation is the most difficult topic and the topics taught by Dr. ice ko is much more interesting and easier.
reviews.comment_teaching:
100% attendance of Dr. ice ko lecture is needed because the lecture notes do not contain the main point for the exam, you need to take notes during her lecture.
Professor Liu spoke very small.
The lecture notes of Professor Zeng is a little bit messy and contain excessive information.
Dr. ice ko does not let us to sit at the last row because she thinks we should reserve the last row seats for those late comers to minimize disturbance.
reviews.comment_grading:
I get B grade only even if i get 78.8% in total. I was very disappointed, confused and frustrated. Maybe the mean is very high.
The mid term exam had MCQ, fill in the blank and long questions.
The final exam had MCQ and long questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only have mid term and final exam.
The  course outline said there will be some quizzes. But we didn't have any quizzes until the end of the course. Maybe the instructor just wants us to attend all the lectures.

reviews.author: AhBo
reviews.comment_content: Midterm was not hard, not much covered and some stuff are what you already know. Some students ruined the long question. If you have anything that do not understand during the lecture ( I suppose quite a lot) go ask professor. I think his explanation after the lecture was better to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall it is good. The only problem is that he jumps to other topics all of sudden, sometimes totally unrelated. He is quite wordy, so lots of times, he cannot finish the content on time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading according to school policy, i suppose. Got what I expected
One midterm one final.Midterm percentage was around 35 and final 55.  MCQ and some long questionsfor both but MCQ percentage is much higher
reviews.comment_workload: Final was very tricky. It was multiple choice question where you can choose multiple answers (hate the most).

reviews.author: wasd0109
reviews.title: Reciting then brainstorming.
reviews.comment_content: The part with taxonomy was a real challenge for me, so many reciting!! But afterward when it is more about BIODIVERSITY, the part is relatively easier.
reviews.comment_teaching: Except that Dr. Liu speak a bit tooooooooo soft. I think it is acceptable. Dr. Zeng is friendly and willing to answer questions and Dr. Ko is passionate in teaching, it makes me very focused during her lecture, instructor such passionate in teaching vary rare in university, some may think that this is troublesome but I think credits should be given to her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm covering parts before midterm and exam covering parts between midterm and exam. The midterm require some straight reciting and thus test student's ability to memorize the lecture notes a lot.
Final exams consist of part of reciting and critical thinking (Part of Dr. Ko). When I attempted the final exam, I was frustrated with Dr. Ko's part as it is really tricky but it end up quite well for me. Just try to answer all the questions.

Mean in midterm, above mean 1.5 SD in final and B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Recite recite recite then lecture lecture. Dr. Ko cover a lot of topics included in exam during lecture without them printed out in lecture notes and she requires us to copy the part in our own way instead of word by word by giving us limited time to copy it. If this could be considered workload then the rating could be a bit lower.

reviews.author: bonlau
reviews.comment_content: cover most of the part of biodiversity and general biology, just a few parts overlap with LIFS1030. The content go through quite fast, therefore it is better to do some reading before lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite good overall, Mr. Liu's parts could elaborate more
Pay attention in lectures and remember to drop notes in Ms. Ko's lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Work hard in mid term, otherwise it is difficult to get good grade.
final exam Class mean 57.9 and s.d. 12.3 mean is C
reviews.comment_workload: Only midterm and exam, and do readings before lectures would be much better

reviews.author: xxxxx5
reviews.title: 背野course
reviews.comment_content:
The basic knowledge about biodiversity on both land and sea, Darwin finches theory and biomass.
The content is somehow easy, and you can understand without difficulties on your own.
I think it is not a must to attend the lecture, especially when it is a 9am lesson. :D
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liu Hongbin tends to share self experience and speaks too soft.
Zeng Qinglu is kind but simply reads out the power point.
Ice Ko always asks questions and with a blank ppt. but those missing content can actually be found in textbook.
reviews.comment_grading:
Above mean nearly one SD got a B, so the grading is normal
Midterm will take place in LT and no seating plan. You can simply sit next to each other:D
The exam paper is more or less the same with the past paper, so do find the source :D
reviews.comment_workload:
One midterm
One final
Both main rely on reciting contents
Better read the textbook because the content of the power point is adequate and usually have some concept gap.
Final has a heavier weighting as I remember.

reviews.author: catlovers
reviews.comment_content:
It is easy to follow as long as you have paid attention to the instructors' teaching. It starts with introducing the concept of evolution and classification of biodiversity (genetic, ecological and organisimal) then it will jump into different divided categories (principle of natural selection, microevolution, different sub kingdoms' evolution history etc) followed by a brief introduction of marine ecology
I personally advise you to read the textbooks since they help you understand more about the concepts
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ice Ko's teaching pace is rather fast so better attend all her lectures (I am pretty sure the final exam paper was done by ice ko and ATTENTION: some answers are not found in lecture pts!!! I felt like doing a LS paper at that time)
Liang's teaching is okay and he is really nice!
As for Zeng, well he only reads the content on the pts so his teaching is fair
*** don't hesitate to ask them questions if you don't understand the concepts they taught!
reviews.comment_grading:
it's okay, not like as bas as what I heard from the seniors.
mid term: above 0.8-1 SD
final: ice ko never shows her marking to us since she thinks her marking is unquestionable. (I guess above 1 SD)
final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: mid term quiz (rather easy) and final exam (challenging, mc was easy, LQ was a bit difficult as you need to write a lot)

reviews.author: AnnaH.
reviews.comment_content: Lots of new terms from Prof. Liu as he went on describing the classification of life and what falls under each category. He loved using examples from marine biology. His exam was rather easy, although the lecture notes may seem overwhelming. :p
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture notes don't have much words on it, so you've got to pay attention to him when in class. Take notes, don't skip class, and you'll be fine :)
reviews.comment_grading: Revise well!! (Even though they say you don't have to memorize it. Obviously, understanding the content should be enough, but how will you write the answer if you don't remember it?) :p
reviews.comment_workload: This course is based on mid-term and final exams only. Grading percentage varies: Final exam weighs more, about 65%, if I remember correctly.

reviews.author: P!nky
reviews.comment_content: classification of organisms, evolution theory , different types of speciations ,  knowledge about different biomes (i.e. rain forest and coral reef)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Zeng's teaching was very clear and he showed many interesting video during lectures.
Professor Liu's teaching was a bit boring perhaps because his topics were all about classification
Dr Ko taught very slowly because she always interacted with students and waited for students to answer her questions which is a bit time-consuming.
reviews.comment_grading: it is generally good if you have revised the notes and attended all of the lectures by Dr Ko.
reviews.comment_workload:
only having midterm and final exam
the workload is very reasonable

reviews.author: thatperson
reviews.title: An okay course
reviews.comment_content: The contents are interesting but sometimes repetitive for science students. Overall has quite a bit of content to revise. Apart from memorising, this course also encourages students to master the contents or concepts given.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both Prof LIU and ZENG has the same teaching style, quite systematic and reads from the ppt.

However Prof KO engages students in her lessons and I love this type of teaching style. This enhances your understanding towards her topics.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is a bit harsh. I've gotten above mean for both exams but still fell in the B range. If you want an A grade, you have to work extra hard.
reviews.comment_workload: No work required but students should read ahead lectures so to understand and conceptualise the knowledge. Sometimes the professors will not go through all the notes so students have to prepare after lectures as well.

reviews.author: 濤
reviews.title: ENVS major
reviews.comment_content:
midterm前講唔同kingdom,domain個D野，後半就係講進化論，speciation, corals, rainforest同biodiversity。
基本上都都係死記ga la，不過DSE level bio都叫cover左大約1/3左右，溫下書都唔會話死ge
reviews.comment_teaching:
ICE KO對於小弟依D上堂但係唔多聽書ge人黎講絕對係惡夢，我唔否認依種interactive ge堂方法的確令上堂ge人學到野，但係我真心頂唔順，而重點係我有理由相信佢認得曬讀ENVS ge所有人，所以小弟唔敢遲到走堂...而小弟係ENVS feild trip曾經聽到佢問人係咪無上堂...
不過平心而論，ice ko都幾有heart ge，算係我U life見到最似一個老師ge prof.

PS ice ko堂一定要抄notes
reviews.comment_grading: Grade就一般般la唔算靚，midterm above ~1.3SD, final above ~0.3 SD最後B左
reviews.comment_workload:
無咩workload ge，如果得閒溫下書ga wa考試就輕鬆D ge
利申唔係aim A range ge 小薯

reviews.author: NOIUE
reviews.title: ENVS Major course
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm之前既嘢真係比較悶
主要講taxon, 講到plant 同fungi真係背到hihi,佢D問題問到比較detail,份卷會要你比example,最好考midterm之前每樣都背定D examples
midterm之後先係E個course 既精髓,講natural selection 同evolution,再加ice ko bb既rainforest and coral reef
Mid term後內容比較注重理解,比較得意
Content比C係因為前半真係太悶
reviews.comment_teaching:
成個course我淨係上左頭果堂同尾3果堂
唔太清楚教成點
midterm前既notes幾1999
不過Ice Ko教書有保證,聽佢講完會明好多
reviews.comment_grading:
OK La
Midterm 低mean 少少
final高半sd有B
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm:very big workload
Final: easy:)考final果日我一日考2科都輕鬆
睇左2次就算

reviews.author: 新垣結衣
reviews.comment_content:
一mt 一final
兩次考嘅野唔同
不過唔多,大約600頁slide
基本上你肯背肯溫都唔太多(相比其他lifs course)
而且考嘅野大部分都係common sense:
生物分類,進化論,corals之類
reviews.comment_teaching:
有3個人教
第一個係HONGBIN
主要教基本分類
教學就同普通大陸Prof無分別,讀PPT

第二個唔知(因為中間基本上走曬堂)
prof係大陸人黎
教evolution同darwin
不過全程播片, 一堂兩條45分鐘片
上唔上無分別

第三個係envs極品冰姐,local
教corals同rainforest
佢d ppt好鐘意留空幾頁,要黎特登抄
上堂遲到會睥住你同堂堂話人遲到,但自己又會遲到
不過上堂有互動有問題要答,相對上上得專心同學到野
reviews.comment_grading: mt同final above 0,5sd 有b
reviews.comment_workload:
no workload
係冰姐堂要抄notes

reviews.author: Chiuy
reviews.title: Easy course
reviews.comment_content: It is a quite easy course, easy to catch up if you have study biology in your secondary school. Syllabus before the midterm is all about memorizing the lecture notes. Syllabus after the midterm is about "blowing water", cuz most of the content is "common sense" if you have studied biology before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Midterm is all about memorizing the characteristics of life such as bacteria, fungi, plants etc.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good. easy to achieve A range
reviews.comment_workload: not much workload, no participation marks, no group project or individual reports. If you can handle it, you can simply skip all the lessons. have mid term and final.
